page.title: 01GENERAL INTRODUCTION TO AREA
page.content: Our Domesday area is mainly rural with over twenty farms within our twelve kilometre square area.Most of the farms have grassland cultivated for cattle,pigs or horses. The main residential area is the village of Cheswick Green which was constructed during the 1970's as the 'complete'village.The only other residences in the area are farmhouses and cottages dotted in the countryside. The Stratford Canal runs through the area as will the new M42 motorway,at present being constructed.The main road within the area,until the completion of the M42,is the Stratford Road,which runs from the centre of Birmingham through to Solihull centre. Some old houses,like Bentley Manor and Drayton House,are within this area,as well as St.Patrick's Vicarage.
